SUMMARY: NESTED | FIELD | CONSTR | METHOD DETAIL: FIELD | CONSTR | METHOD

com.smartsockets
Interface TipcSrv

All Superinterfaces:
TipcConnClient
public interface TipcSrv
extends TipcConnClient

Provides an interface to RTserver connections.

The single, global RTserver connection instance of this class is returned through a factory class by TipcSvc.getSrv().

This class is a subclass of TipcConnClient, and much of the interesting functionality is provided by that class.

A simple example: 

   // get the single, global RTserver connection instance
   TipcSrv srv = TipcSvc.getSrv();

   // create and send a message
   TipcMsg msg = TipcSvc.createMsg(TipcMt.INFO);
   msg.setDest("/foo");
   msg.appendStr("hello");
   srv.send(msg);

In this example, the send(com.smartsockets.TipcMsg) method automatically connects to the RTserver. You may also connect to the RTserver explicitly with create(int, byte[]).

An RTserver must be running before any attempt is made to connect to it. This class will automatically try to connect to any RTservers that appear in the "ss.server_names" option, trying each RTserver in turn until it successfully connects to one.

See Also:
TipcConnClient, TipcSvc

Method Detail

create

public boolean create(int auth_policy_id,
                      byte[] auth_data)
               throws TipcException
Creates the RTserver connection using the default connection type (CONN_FULL) and with the specified credentials.

Connects to and handshakes with the RTserver process. Does not attempt to auto-start an RTserver if one cannot be contacted. Instead, it will loop through the list of servers specified with the ss.server_names option until a connection is made. This process is synchronous, and all other threads that attempt to use the connection will block until this succeeds, or fails completely.

Parameters:
auth_policy_id - user-specific authorization policy identifier to be sent to the Security Manager
auth_data - user-specific authorization data to be sent to the Security Manager
Returns:
true if a successful connection was made. If the server cannot be connected to at all, then false will be returned.
Throws:
TipcTimeoutException - if the client timed out waiting for RTserver to reply to a connection request.
TipcAccessDeniedException - if the server replied, but denied access. Use TipcAccessDeniedException.getErrNum to determine error code.
TipcIOException - for unrecoverable network failures
TipcBadArgumentException - when an invalid LCN is specified
TipcNotFoundException - when the protocol driver cannot be found
TipcAssertionException - if the LCN hostname is unknown
TipcProxyException - for errors when connecting to a proxy server
TipcException - for all other errors
See Also:
create(int)

create

public boolean create()
               throws TipcException
Creates the RTserver connection using the default connection type (CONN_FULL).

Connects to and handshakes with the RTserver process. Does not attempt to auto-start an RTserver if one cannot be contacted. Instead, it will loop through the list of servers specified with the ss.server_names option until a connection is made. This process is synchronous, and all other threads that attempt to use the connection will block until this succeeds, or fails completely.

Returns:
true if a successful connection was made. If the server cannot be connected to at all, then false will be returned.
Throws:
TipcTimeoutException - if the client timed out waiting for RTserver to reply to a connection request.
TipcAccessDeniedException - if the server replied, but denied access. This is usually because the client's unique subject isn't unique within the client's project.
TipcIOException - for unrecoverable network failures
TipcBadArgumentException - when an invalid LCN is specified
TipcNotFoundException - when the protocol driver cannot be found
TipcAssertionException - if the LCN hostname is unknown
TipcProxyException - for errors when connecting to a proxy server
TipcException - for all other errors
See Also:
create(int)

create

public boolean create(int connType)
               throws TipcException
Creates the server connection using a specified connection type.

Connects to and handshakes with the RTserver process. Does not attempt to auto-start an RTserver if one cannot be contacted. Instead, it will loop through the list of servers specified with the ss.server_names option until a connection is made. This process is synchronous, and all other threads that attempt to use the connection will block until this succeeds, or fails completely.

Parameters:
connType - one of the valid connection types: CONN_WARM or CONN_FULL
Returns:
true if a successful connection was made. If the server cannot be connected to at all, then false will be returned. Exceptions will be thrown if partial connections are made and other errors occur.
Throws:
TipcTimeoutException - if the client timed out waiting for RTserver to reply to a connection request.
TipcAccessDeniedException - if the server replied, but denied access. This is usually because the client's unique subject isn't unique within the client's project.
TipcIOException - for unrecoverable network failures
TipcException - for all other errors
See Also:
create(int, byte[])

destroy

public void destroy(int connType)
             throws TipcException
Destroys (closes) the RTserver connection using a specified connection type.

Parameters:
connType - one of the valid connection types: CONN_WARM or CONN_FULL
Throws:
TipcException - for all errors

send

public void send(TipcMsg msg)
          throws TipcException
Send a message.

This method actually queues the data for later transmission. It is not actually sent until flush() is called, either by the user directly, or by the auto-flush mechanism, based on the buffer size. The auto-flush mechanism is regulated by the ss.server_auto_flush_size option.

Note: This method will automatically create a connection to the RTserver if one does not yet exist.

Specified by:
send in interface TipcConnClient
Parameters:
msg - the message to send.
Throws:
TipcBadArgumentException - if the message destination is not a valid subject
TipcException - if no server connection and auto-connect is false

sendRpc

public TipcMsg sendRpc(TipcMsg msg,
                       double timeout)
                throws TipcException
Send a RPC message.

Note: This method will automatically create a connection to the RTserver if one does not yet exist.

Specified by:
sendRpc in interface TipcConnClient
Parameters:
msg - the message to send.
timeout - the amount of time (in seconds) to wait for the result
Returns:
the result message, or null if the timeout expires
Throws:
TipcBadArgumentException - if the message destination is not a valid subject
TipcException - if no server connection and auto-connect is false

flush

public void flush()
           throws TipcException
Flushes queued data to the connection.

This ensures all buffered data is written immediately. The outbound queue will be flushed automatically when it reaches a set size, set by the ss.server_auto_flush_size option.

Note: This method will automatically create a connection to the RTserver if one does not yet exist.

Specified by:
flush in interface TipcConnClient
Throws:
TipcException - if no server connection and auto-connect is false

check

public boolean check(int checkMode,
                     double timeout)
              throws TipcException
Checks for traffic on the connection. If check_mode is TipcDefs.IO_CHECK_READ, this method will return true if there is data available to be read. If TipcDefs.IO_CHECK_WRITE, true will be returned if data can be written to the connection without blocking.

If the ss.server_read_timeout option is 0.0, this method will block for up to the specified timeout. Otherwise, this method will return immediately.

NOTE: This method is rarely used by end-user programs.

Note: This method will automatically create a connection to the RTserver if one does not yet exist.

Specified by:
check in interface TipcConnClient
Parameters:
checkMode - either TipcDefs.IO_CHECK_READ or TipcDefs.IO_CHECK_WRITE.
timeout - the length of time to wait for traffic (in seconds). If timeout is 0.0, the connection will be polled, and no waiting will be done. If timeout is TipcDefs.TIMEOUT_FOREVER, the connection will block until traffic is available.
Returns:
true if traffic has occurred, false if timed out.
Throws:
TipcInterruptedException - when interrupted by another thread
TipcException - for all errors

next

public TipcMsg next(double timeout)
             throws TipcException
Get messages from the inbound queue. If no messages are waiting in the inbound queue then this method will wait for the specified timeout for a message to arrive.

Note: This method will automatically create a connection to the RTserver if one does not yet exist.

Specified by:
next in interface TipcConnClient
Parameters:
timeout - length of time (in seconds) to wait for a message to arrive.
Returns:
the message read, or null if timeout expires.
Throws:
TipcInterruptedException - when interrupted by another thread
TipcException - for all errors

isRunning

public boolean isRunning()
                  throws TipcException
Checks if this process is connected to RTserver, and connects if it isn't.

Returns:
true if RTserver is running and connected. Returns false if there is an error connecting.
Throws:
TipcTimeoutException - if the client timed out waiting for RTserver to reply to a connection request.
TipcAccessDeniedException - if the server replied, but denied access. This is usually because the client's unique subject isn't unique within the client's project.
TipcIOException - for unrecoverable network failures
TipcException - for all other errors

setSubjectSubscribeEx

public void setSubjectSubscribeEx(java.lang.String subject,
                                  boolean status,
                                  int type,
                                  int flags,
                                  java.lang.Object obj)
                           throws TipcException
Set extended subscribe status on a subject.

Note: This method will automatically create a connection to the RTserver if one does not yet exist.

Parameters:
subject - the subject to set the status on
status - the status to set, true to subscribe, false to unsubscribe.
type - the type of subscribe as follows: 
          SUBEX_TYPE_NONE - Standard subscribe (setSubjectSubscribe)
          SUBEX_TYPE_CACHE - Caching support subscribe.  See flags
            below for a list of valid values.
flags - the flags used by the subscribe types. For SUBEX_TYPE_NONE, this parameter is ignored. For SUBEX_TYPE_CACHE valid values are: 
            SUBEX_CACHE_FLAG_LATEST_MSG - Get latest message from
              the cache, or first message from the cloud, whichever
              is received first.
            SUBEX_CACHE_FLAG_INITIAL_LOAD - buffer all incoming messages
              from the cloud while waiting for all messages from the
              cache to be received and processed.
obj - - extra info needed by each type. For SUBEX_TYPE_NONE, this paratmeter is ignored. For SUBEX_TYPE_CACHE, this parameter must contain a valid TipcCache object.
Throws:
TipcBadArgumentException - if the subject is invalid
TipcAlreadySubscribedException - if already subscribed to subject
TipcNotSubscribedException - if not subscribed to subject
TipcException - for all other errors

                           throws TipcException

Note: This method will automatically create a connection to the RTserver if one does not yet exist.

Throws:

TipcNotSubscribedException - if not subscribed to subject
TipcException - for all other errors

addProcessCb

public TipcCb addProcessCb(TipcProcessCb l,
                           java.lang.String subject,
                           java.lang.Object arg)
Adds a callback for messages published to a specific subject. The subject argument may be null, in which case the callback will match all subjects.

Parameters:
l - the callback to add
subject - the subject to register this callback for, or null
arg - the user-defined argument passed to the callback
Returns:
the newly created callback
See Also:
TipcConnClient.addProcessCb(com.smartsockets.TipcProcessCb, com.smartsockets.TipcMt, java.lang.Object)

addProcessCb

public TipcCb addProcessCb(TipcProcessCb l,
                           java.lang.String subject,
                           short priority,
                           java.lang.Object arg)
Adds a callback for messages published to a specific subject. The subject argument may be null, in which case the callback will match all subjects.

Parameters:
l - the callback to add
subject - the subject of the message to look for
priority - the priority of the callback
arg - the user-defined argument passed to the callback
Returns:
the newly created callback
See Also:
TipcConnClient.addProcessCb(com.smartsockets.TipcProcessCb, com.smartsockets.TipcMt, java.lang.Object)

lookupProcessCb

public TipcCb lookupProcessCb(TipcProcessCb l,
                              TipcMt mt,
                              java.lang.String subject,
                              java.lang.Object arg)
                       throws TipcException
Looks up a message callback for processing messages by type and subject.

Parameters:
l - the callback class
mt - the message type
subject - the subject
arg - the user-defined argument passed to the callback
Returns:
the callback, or null if the callback doesn't exist
Throws:
TipcBadArgumentException - if the callback table is corrupt
TipcException - for all other errors

removeCreateCb

public void removeCreateCb(TipcCb cb)
                    throws TipcException
Removes a callback for RTserver connection creation.

Parameters:
cb - the callback to remove
Throws:
TipcBadArgumentException - if the callback table is corrupt
TipcAssertionException - if the callback is corrupt
TipcException - for all other errors

removeDestroyCb

                     throws TipcException
Removes a callback for RTserver connection destruction.

Parameters:
cb - the callback to remove
Throws:
TipcBadArgumentException - if the callback table is corrupt
TipcAssertionException - if the callback is corrupt
TipcException - for all other errors

logAddMt

public void logAddMt(int logType,
                     TipcMt mt)
              throws TipcException
Adds a message type for message logging. Messages will be logged to the file specified by the ss.log_in_data, ss.log_out_data, ss.log_in_status, ss.log_out_status, ss.log_in_internal, or ss.log_out_internal option based upon the logging type; LOG_DATA, LOG_STATUS, or LOG_INTERNAL.

Parameters:
logType - the message logging type
mt - the message type
Throws:
TipcBadArgumentException - thrown if the message logging type is invalid
TipcException - for all other errors

logAddMt

public void logAddMt(int logType,
                     int mtNum)
              throws TipcException
Adds a message type number for message logging. Messages will be logged to the file specified by the ss.log_in_data, ss.log_out_data, ss.log_in_status, ss.log_out_status, ss.log_in_internal, or ss.log_out_internal option based upon the logging type; LOG_DATA, LOG_STATUS, or LOG_INTERNAL.

Parameters:
logType - the message logging type
mtNum - the message type number
Throws:
TipcNotFoundException - if the message type does not exist
TipcBadArgumentException - thrown if the message logging type is invalid
TipcException - for all other errors

logRemoveMt

public void logRemoveMt(int logType,
                        TipcMt mt)
                 throws TipcException
Removes a message type from message logging.

Parameters:
logType - the message logging type
mt - the message type
Throws:
TipcBadArgumentException - thrown if the message logging type is invalid
TipcNotFoundException - thrown if the message type is not being logged for the indicated logging type
TipcException - for all other errors
See Also:
logAddMt(int, com.smartsockets.TipcMt)

logRemoveMt

public void logRemoveMt(int logType,
                        int mtNum)
                 throws TipcException
Removes a message type number from message logging.

Parameters:
logType - the message logging type
mtNum - the message type number
Throws:
TipcBadArgumentException - thrown if the message logging type is invalid
TipcNotFoundException - thrown if the message type is not being logged for the indicated logging type or if the message type does not exist
TipcException - for all other errors
See Also:
logAddMt(int, com.smartsockets.TipcMt)

getDefaultErrorCb

public TipcCb getDefaultErrorCb()
Gets the default RTclient error callback. This is useful if you wish to replace the default error callback. The returned TipcCb object can be passed to the removeErrorCb method.

The default RTclient error callback first calls destroy(TipcSrv.CONN_WARM) to destroy the current connection to the RTserver, then calls create() to create a new connection to the RTserver.

Returns:
the TipcCb containing the default error callback
See Also:
TipcConnClient.removeErrorCb(com.smartsockets.TipcCb)

setUsernamePassword

public void setUsernamePassword(java.lang.String username,
                                java.lang.String password)
                         throws TipcException
Sets the username and password for the RTclient when connecting to an RTserver with the Basic Security Driver installed. The password is immediately encrypted and is never sent in plain text to the RTserver.

Parameters:
username - the username to use for authentication and authorization
password - the password to use for authentication
Throws:
TipcSrvAlreadyConnectedException - if the RTclient is already connected to the RTserver
TipcException
